scramble.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to climb up, down, or over something quickly and with difficulty, especially using your hands to help you
scramble.translation[0].definitions[0].e: They tried to scramble up the cliff.
She scrambled down the tree as quickly as she could.
scramble.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to move somewhere in a hurried awkward way
scramble.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Alan scrambled out of the way.
Micky scrambled to his feet  (=stood up very quickly and awkwardly) and hurried into the kitchen.
scramble.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to try to do something difficult very quickly
scramble.translation[0].definitions[2].e: They were scrambling to give the impression that the situation was under control.
scramble.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to struggle or compete with other people to get or reach something
scramble.translation[0].definitions[3].e: Thousands of people will be scrambling for tickets.
scramble.translation[0].definitions[4].d: to use special equipment to mix messages, radio signals etc into a different form, so that they cannot be understood by other people without the correct equipment
scramble.translation[0].definitions[4].e: Our conversation will be electronically scrambled.
scramble.translation[0].definitions[5].d: to mix words, ideas, sentences etc so that they are not in the right order and do not make sense
scramble.translation[0].definitions[5].e: The words in each sentence are scrambled.
scramble.translation[0].definitions[6].d: if a military plane scrambles, it goes up into the air very quickly in order to escape or to attack an enemy
scramble.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a difficult climb in which you have to use your hands to help you
scramble.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The village was a 20-minute scramble away.
scramble.translation[1].definitions[1].d: a situation in which people compete with and push each other in order to get what they want
scramble.translation[1].definitions[1].e: the usual scramble for the bathroom every morning
a scramble to carry the baggage into the house
scramble.translation[1].definitions[2].d: a situation in which something has to be done very quickly, with a lot of rushing around
scramble.translation[1].definitions[2].e: It was a mad scramble trying to get things ready in time.
scramble.translation[1].definitions[3].d: a motorcycle race over rough ground
